headline: Reserve Bank of Australia Deputy Governor Says A$ Likely To Stay High
summary: The Australian dollar is expected to remain strong, a central bank official said Monday, despite a brief dip below parity against its U.S. counterpart in midday trading.

headline: Batteries Shown to Pose Risk for Kids
summary: The proliferation of electronic gadgets in American homes may have an unwelcome side effect: a rising number of emergency-room visits by children who have stuck batteries in their mouths, ears or noses.

headline: IMF: 2012 Growth In Sub-Saharan Africa Seen At Least 5.5%
summary: Countries in sub-Saharan Africa are expected to register economic growth of at least 5.5% in 2012, compared with 5% last year, driven by new resource exploitation and recovery from drought, the International Monetary Fund said Monday.

headline: Personal & Household Goods
summary: Na Eun-chae, an analyst at Korea Investment & Securities, was the personal and household goods sector winner in the 2011 Asia's Best Analysts survey.

headline: Chasing the Biggest Share
summary: Even in the calmest times, commercial real-estate brokers are known to jump from one firm to another to get a bigger share of commissions. Now analysts are saying the movement could accelerate.

headline: Please Be a Little More Quiet When Shouting at Customers
summary: For centuries, traders in Turkey's bazaars have been perfecting their famous yells to trumpet their wares. But now an obscure provision of a new law is seeking to turn down the volume.

headline: Taiwan Finance Minister: May Need 10 Years To Return To Balanced Budget
summary: Taiwan's Finance Minister Christina Liu said Monday the government may need a decade to return to a balanced budget, citing an uncertain global economic outlook.

headline: Commissions Multiply Under Cuomo
summary: Cuomo came into office pledging to prune the weeds of bureaucracy, but commissions and task forces have flourished in his term so far.

headline: Firm by Firm: Tally of Awards Won by 42 Research Firms
summary: Firms are ranked according to the total number of Asia's Best Analysts awards their analysts earned. There were 93 awards this year, three each in 21 sectors and 10 countries/regions. Winners who qualified in both sector and country categories were only counted once.

headline: City Explores Private Deal For Meters
summary: New York City is taking tentative steps toward turning over the operation of its nearly 39,000 parking meters to a private company, with a cautious eye toward avoiding costly missteps made in other cities.

headline: Asia Powers Agree on Trade Talks
summary: The leaders of China, Japan and South Korea agreed to begin free-trade negotiations this year, opening the possibility of a deal that could rival the world's largest free-trade zones.

headline: Beijing's Growth Tools Limited
summary: China's leaders sought to boost flagging growth, but the measures don't pack the wallop they once had.

headline: ResCap Set to File for Bankruptcy
summary: Ally Financial's mortgage subsidiary is expected to file for bankruptcy late Sunday or early Monday morning, a person familiar with the matter said.

headline: Delays Slow Review of Divorce Laws
summary: A state commission tasked with reviewing a contentious aspect of New York's divorce reform laws is four months behind in delivering an expected report.

headline: Mexican Drug War Yields Grisly Toll
summary: Mexico's most violent drug cartel claimed responsibility for killing 49 people whose decapitated bodies were dumped along a road near the business capital of Monterrey, part of a turf war between the country's two strongest gangs.

headline: NZ 1Q Retail Sales Fall As World Cup Boost Wanes
summary: Retail sales in New Zealand fell in the first quarter from a quarter earlier, following strong sales in the second half of 2011 when a large number of international visitors came for the Rugby World Cup.

headline: Brand Takes a Tweeting
summary: To tweet or not to tweet? That was the question. I resisted jumping aboard the Twitter bandwagon until last week for reasons both practical and philosophical.

headline: Romania PM Vows Growth, Stability
summary: Romania's new left-leaning premier pledged to stick to strict spending limits while trying to revive growth, as he seeks to balance the demands of deficit-averse investors with the desires of his austerity-weary constituents.

summary: How many executives have been convicted of criminal wrongdoing related to the tumultuous events of 2008-2009? The Justice Department doesn't know the answer.

summary: Britain's closely watched austerity program is facing a difficult stretch in which its effectiveness and political viability will be tested.

summary: The surprising thing about the slump in drilling for natural gas is that has taken it so long, given what has happened to prices and to stockpiles.

summary: After the ambitious, red-headed Morgan Hartley graduated from the University of Chicago, the grand-scion of RKO Pictures chief executive Ted Hartley wanted a challenge for Christmas.

headline: Brazil's Central Bank Sees Interest Rate Cycle Moving Lower-Report
